result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin A. Repinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Attend and successfully complete domestic violence court, if agent recommends.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin A. Repinski

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State. Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Court advised the charges and potential penalties.  Defendant understood.  Defendant plead guilty to count 2.  Count 1 dismissed and read in.   Plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements reviewed with defendant.  Defendant understood.  Joint recommendation for 1 year probation with conditions.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis.   Court found the defendant made his plea and waived his rights freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Find guilty as plead to.  State: 1  year probation,  the defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC. DV court and domestic violence counseling if agent recommends.  s/m employment.   Attorney Fredrickson agrees with the State's recommendation.  Asks for 1 year.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered sentence withheld, 1 year probation,   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC.  Attend DV court, if agent recommends.  Maintain employment. No contact with victim.
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared with Attorney Paul Fredrickson.  Can be set for plea/sentencing.  Court set for 6/1/15 at 1:30 am.

Pre-trial conference at 04-22-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 05-11-2015 03:00 pm.

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person.  Attorney Paul Fredrickson appeared specially.  Reading of complaint waived, and defendant stood mute to the charges.  Court entered NGP on defendant's behalf.  PTC & STC set.  15CM11 to track.  Plea/sentencing on that case canceled.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals:  Angie B.  If defendant needs anything from address/residence he must be accompanied by a law enforcement officer.  Law enforcement is not required to drive him to that location.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals:  Angie B.  If defendant needs anything from address/residence he must be accompanied by a law enforcement officer.  Law enforcement is not required to drive him to that location.

Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail with no attorney present.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant states he has SPD Paul Fredrickson on other matters.  $2500 signature bond set with conditions and initial appearance date set for 3-30-15 at 9:30.  Court advised defendant to contact attorney.
